intro: Ruschia filipetala, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that resemble tulips. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are succulent and often covered in a fine layer of white, powdery wax. Ruschia filipetala is popular in rock gardens and as a drought-tolerant ornamental plant.
